unit_learning_outcomes.description: Conduct English-Chinese translation within given time
Analyze English texts with given contexts
Identify and discuss fundamental translation theories
Develop ability in independent and reflective learning through assessing and responding to ideas
Demonstrate skills of using dictionaries and other tools in translation

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on translation practice, reflection of their translation practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn.

enrolment_rules.description: 80cp at 1000 level or above and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Students are expected to present on their translation strategies adopted for their translation
Students are expected to take notes when translating and reflect on their translation practice. A reflective journal need to be submitted.
Students are expected to prepare for and participate in discussions actively. The workload of this task is included in learning activities.
Students will do a translation test by the end of the semester.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit introduces fundamental translation theories and skills and encourages their use in English-Chinese translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will learn how to analyze and comprehend English texts in various contexts as well as how to deliver the equivalent message in idiomatic Chinese. Students will develop language and cultural competence as well as analytical and problem-solving capabilities in translation.
data.title: English-Chinese Translation I

description: This unit introduces fundamental translation theories and skills and encourages their use in English-Chinese translation practice. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will learn how to analyze and comprehend English texts in various contexts as well as how to deliver the equivalent message in idiomatic Chinese. Students will develop language and cultural competence as well as analytical and problem-solving capabilities in translation.
title: English-Chinese Translation I
